member.summary: The mapping of built-in types to their simple representation.

member.name: F:CommunityToolkit.Diagnostics.TypeExtensions.DisplayNames

member.name: M:CommunityToolkit.Diagnostics.TypeExtensions.ToTypeString(System.Type)
member.summary: Returns a simple representation of a type.
member.param: The input type.
member.returns: The representation of .

member.name: M:CommunityToolkit.Diagnostics.TypeExtensions.FormatDisplayString(System.Type,System.Int32,System.ReadOnlySpan{System.Type})
member.summary: Formats a given instance to its representation.
member.param: The input type.
The offset into the generic type arguments for .
The generic type arguments for .
member.returns: The representation of .

member.name: M:CommunityToolkit.Diagnostics.TypeExtensions.FormatDisplayStringForAllTypes(System.Type[])
member.summary: Formats a given sequence of instances to their representations.
member.param: The input types.
member.returns: The representations of .

remarks.para: This method is explicitly an enumerator to avoid having to use LINQ in , which causes a noticeable binary size increase in AOT scenarios if reflection is enabled (which is the only supported mode).

member.name: T:CommunityToolkit.Diagnostics.ValueTypeExtensions
member.summary: Helpers for working with value types.

member.name: P:CommunityToolkit.Diagnostics.ValueTypeExtensions.HexCharactersTable
member.summary: Gets the table of hex characters (doesn't allocate, maps to .text section, see ).

member.name: M:CommunityToolkit.Diagnostics.ValueTypeExtensions.ToHexString``1(``0)
member.summary: Returns a hexadecimal representation of a given value, left-padded and ordered as big-endian.
member.typeparam: The input type to format to .
member.param: The input value to format to .
member.returns: The hexadecimal representation of (with the '0x' prefix), left-padded to byte boundaries and ordered as big-endian.
member.remarks:
As a byte (8 bits) is represented by two hexadecimal digits (each representing a group of 4 bytes), each representation will always contain an even number of digits. For instance:
Console.WriteLine(1.ToHexString()); // "0x01" Console.WriteLine(((byte)255).ToHexString()); // "0xFF" Console.WriteLine((-1).ToHexString()); // "0xFFFFFFFF"

member.summary: Applied to a method that will never return under any circumstance.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.DoesNotReturnIfAttribute
member.summary: Specifies that the method will not return if the associated Boolean parameter is passed the specified value.

member.summary: Initializes the attribute with the specified parameter value.
member.param: The condition parameter value. Code after the method will be considered unreachable by diagnostics if the argument to the associated parameter matches this value.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.DoesNotReturnIfAttribute.ParameterValue
member.summary: Gets the condition parameter value.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.NotNullAttribute
member.summary: Specifies that an output will not be null even if the corresponding type allows it. Specifies that an input argument was not null when the call returns.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.StackTraceHiddenAttribute
member.summary: Types and Methods attributed with StackTraceHidden will be omitted from the stack trace text shown in StackTrace.ToString() and Exception.StackTrace

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
